title: Italy presses ahead with claim on central bank's $300 billion gold pile
description:
By Giuseppe Fonte

ROME (Reuters) -Italian ruling lawmakers intend to press ahead with a claim that the central bank's $300 billion in gold reserves belong to the state, ​a senator said on Thursday, despite widespread concern that the move could breach EU rules.

Senator Lucio ‌Malan, from Prime Min...

title: Currency Exchange Rate Calculator
description: This currency converter tool provides foreign exchange rates by Mastercard to convert from the transaction currency to your card's currency for cross-border purchases and ATM transactions.

title: What Is the Foreign Exchange Market: A Guide
description:
We all know what money is. It’s what we use to buy and sell goods and services and, from a savings and investing standpoint, it’s how we keep score of (i.e., place a value on) the assets we own.

But money does have a price tag. It’s called an exchange rate, and in the global currency market , it’s ...

title: Traveling Abroad? Order Currency Before You Go
description:
Upon landing in a foreign country, expect a lot of lines. There’s immigration, passport control and customs inspection. But there’s one line you can — and absolutely should — skip: the airport currency exchange.

Not only does the airport currency exchange counter’s line cut into precious time abroa...

title: China Factory Activity Slumps for Longest Stretch on Record
description:
China’s factory activity improved but remained in contraction in November, extending its streak of declines to a record as the country’s economic slowdown deepens.

The official manufacturing purchasing managers’ index was 49.2, remaining below the 50 mark that separates growth and contraction for a...

title: The Foundation of the U.S. Economy Appears to Be Breaking, and Wall Street Has Turned a Blind Eye
description: To begin with, the delinquency rate for commercial mortgage-backed securities (CMBS) hit an all-time high of 11.76% in October 2025, according to commercial real estate research and analytics firm Trepp. To put this figure into perspective, CMBS delinquencies have increased almost tenfold since 2023...

title: Tim Wu knows where you got your ‘economic resentment’ and that ‘weird feeling of something you like getting worse’: It’s ‘the age of extraction’
description: Tim Wu, the influential Columbia Law School professor who previously served in the Biden administration, is back with a message: Modern American capitalism has devolved into a system defined by the accumulation of market power and “extraction,” generating a profound sense of “economic resentment” ac...

title: Scott Bessent says ‘move from a blue state to a red state’ is No. 1 way to beat inflation, leaving critics stunned
description:

title: Why you may not want lower prices as much as you think you do
description: Americans keep saying it: They want lower prices. Groceries have swelled 25 percent in the past five years. The average price of a new car just topped $50,000. Energy bills are soaring, as are health care premiums and child care costs. And housing has come up as much as 30 percent since 2020, for bo...

title: Mortgage and refinance interest rates today, November 30, 2025: The 6% 30-year mortgage is back, could 5% be next?
description: Mortgage rates vary across the nation, but some borrowers are getting the lowest rates in a long time. According to Zillow data, the current 30-year fixed average mortgage rate is 6.00%. title: A compass for monetary policy under model uncertainty
description: Central banks routinely face two forms of uncertainty when setting monetary policy. One concerns the economic model: different structural models can generate different trade-offs and often imply very different policy responses.
